alert.note: Alert for Rutland; Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 29 at 4:17PM EDT until July 29 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern Vermont, including the following counties, Rutland and Windsor. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 417 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.25 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.33 to 0.75 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Woodstock, Chester, Reading, Plymouth, Cavendish, Ludlow Village, Ludlow, Bridgewater, Mount Holly, West Windsor, Woodstock Village, Weston, Hartland, Mount Tabor, Camp Plymouth State Park, Camp Plymouth, Tyson, South Reading, Calvin Coolidge State Park and Coolidge State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
